summary: This document is a Notice of Electronic Filing from the U.S. District Court for the Southern District of New York regarding a letter motion filed by attorney Frank Handelman on behalf of defendant Donald Carr in case USA v. Lowe et al (1:14-cr-00055-LGS). The notice lists numerous attorneys who were electronically mailed the filing, indicating a large, multi-defendant criminal case.

connections.description: Frank Handelman filed a letter motion on behalf of defendant Donald Carr, seeking his reappointment.
Handelman addressed and filed a letter motion to Judge Lorna G. Schofield.
Carr is a defendant in the case over which Judge Schofield presides.

events.title: Letter Motion Filed for Donald Carr
events.description: Attorney Frank Handelman filed a letter motion addressed to Judge Lorna G. Schofield on behalf of defendant Donald Carr, seeking reappointment in case USA v. Lowe et al.

locations: U.S. District Court Southern District of New York
New York, NY 10013 (70 LaFayette Street - Peluso & Tougher)
New York, NY 10017 (369 Lexington Avenue - Scott Tolman's office)
keyFacts: The document is a court notice regarding a letter motion filed by attorney Frank Handelman for defendant Donald Carr in the criminal case USA v. Lowe et al (1:14-cr-00055-LGS).
The motion seeks the 'reappointment' of Donald Carr, suggesting an ongoing legal proceeding where his representation or status is being formalized.
A very large number of attorneys (over 30) are listed as recipients of the filing, indicating a complex, multi-defendant case.
The notice specifies that some attorneys (David Tougher and Scott Tolman) received the document by non-electronic means, highlighting the court's notification procedures.
The document itself is a procedural filing notice and does not contain details about the underlying charges in the Lowe et al case.
